column2: Muhamad, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with Menier's disease about a year ago. I'm a PhD candidate and had a lot of stress. After six months of  taking this medicine (once a day) it often caused me very painful muscle cramps, almost daily. My doctor encouraged me to eat banana, drink more water, avoid caffeine (especially coffee), and to drink a little of Tonic Water for muscle cramps. My doctor advised me to take it every other day and it works for me. My medicine is Triameterine 37.5 mg green tablets.

column2: Lovely1, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It was only when I reduced the stress in my life, included grapefruit and bananas did this medication make any significant positive changes for me.  It kept me tired, blurry-eyed, painful ankles and feet even after lowering my BP. Skin rashes too.  I am tapering off it.  Magnesium Oxide (OTC) and Inositol Choline helps with no side effects at all.
